title: Emergency Response System Proves Effective in Tamil Nadu Scooter Accident
summary: A teenage boy was involved in a scooter accident near Thanjavur Periya Kovil when avoiding a wrong-way driver. The incident highlighted the efficiency of Tamil Nadu's 108 emergency response system, which responded within 10 minutes, though the victim was ultimately transported by friends before ambulance arrival.
content:
A road accident occurred near Thanjavur Periya Kovil around 9 PM when a teenage boy lost control of his scooter while attempting to avoid another rider traveling in the wrong direction. The wrong-way driver fled the scene immediately after the incident.

Witnesses report that the boy fell and lost consciousness, prompting bystanders to gather and attempt to contact his family through his mobile phone. A witness at the scene contacted the 108 emergency service, which responded promptly and dispatched an ambulance within 10 minutes.

Before the ambulance could arrive, a group of the victim's teenage friends reached the location and transported him away by scooter, despite his semi-conscious state. The emergency call was subsequently cancelled.

The incident has drawn attention to the effectiveness of Tamil Nadu's 108 emergency response system, demonstrating the government service's capability to respond swiftly to medical emergencies.
